On August 15, 2011, Microsoft opened a new blog called 'Building Windows 8' for users and developers.<ref>{{cite web|author=Steven Sinofsky |url=http://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/08/15/welcome-to-building-windows-8.aspx |title=Welcome to Building Windows 8 - Building Windows 8 - Site Home - MSDN Blogs |publisher=Blogs.msdn.com |date=2011-08-15 |accessdate=2011-09-08}}</ref>
On August 15, 2011, Microsoft opened a new blog called 'Building Windows 8' for users and developers.<ref>{{cite web|author=Steven Sinofsky |url=http://blogs.msdn.com/b/b8/archive/2011/08/15/welcome-to-building-windows-8.aspx |title=Welcome to Building Windows 8 - Building Windows 8 - Site Home - MSDN Blogs |publisher=Blogs.msdn.com |date=2011-08-15 |accessdate=2011-09-08}}</ref>
â
Microsoft unveiled new Windows 8 features and improvements on September 13, 2011, day one of the BUILD developer conference.<ref name="W8PreviewGuide">[http://download.microsoft.com/download/1/E/4/1E455D53-C382-4A39-BA73-55413F183333/Windows_Developer_Preview-Windows8_guide.pdf Windows 8 Developer Preview Guide]</ref> Microsoft also released a Developer Preview build (Build 8102) of Windows 8 for the developer community to download and start working with.<ref name=BUILD>{{cite web |title=Windows BUILD by Microsoft |url=http://www.buildwindows.com/}}</ref> Windows 8 Developer Preview can be installed on virtualization platforms including VMWare Workstation <ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5081-Install-Windows-VMWare-Workstation.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on VMWare Workstation}}</ref> and [[VirtualBox|Oracle VirtualBox]] <ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5084-How-install-Windows-Oracle-VM-VirtualBox.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on Oracle VirtualBox}}</ref>
+
Microsoft unveiled new Windows 8 features and improvements on September 13, 2011, day one of the BUILD developer conference.<ref name="W8PreviewGuide">[http://download.microsoft.com/download/1/E/4/1E455D53-C382-4A39-BA73-55413F183333/Windows_Developer_Preview-Windows8_guide.pdf Windows 8 Developer Preview Guide]</ref> Microsoft also released a Developer Preview build (Build 8102) of Windows 8 for the developer community to download and start working with.<ref name=BUILD>{{cite web |title=Windows BUILD by Microsoft |url=http://www.buildwindows.com/}}</ref> Windows 8 Developer Preview can be installed on virtualization platforms including [[VMWare Workstation]] <ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5081-Install-Windows-VMWare-Workstation.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on VMWare Workstation}}</ref> and [[VirtualBox|Oracle VirtualBox]] <ref>{{cite web|author=Tony John, Microsoft MVP |url=http://www.mywindowsclub.com/resources/5084-How-install-Windows-Oracle-VM-VirtualBox.aspx |title=Install Windows 8 on Oracle VirtualBox}}</ref>
According to Microsoft, there were more than 500,000 downloads of the Windows 8 Developer Preview within the first 12 hours of its release.<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/09/14/steve-ballmer-touts-500-000-windows-8-downloads-in-less-than-12/</ref>
According to Microsoft, there were more than 500,000 downloads of the Windows 8 Developer Preview within the first 12 hours of its release.<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/09/14/steve-ballmer-touts-500-000-windows-8-downloads-in-less-than-12/</ref>
